author: Zeta Ret
text: Simple printed server from ProtoSS Packages using XeltoSS synthesis

public_methods.onReadRequestBody: request*: http.ClientRequest|http.IncomingMessage, body*: String, response*: http.ServerResponse; return ProtoSSChe
public_methods.pushProtoSSResponse: request*: http.ClientRequest|http.IncomingMessage, response*: http.ServerResponse; return ProtoSSChe
public_methods.readRequestBody: request*: http.ClientRequest|http.IncomingMessage, response*: http.ServerResponse; return ProtoSSChe
public_methods.updateCookies: request*: http.ClientRequest|http.IncomingMessage, response*: http.ServerResponse, headers*: Object; return ProtoSSChe
public_methods.endResponse: request*: http.ClientRequest|http.IncomingMessage, response*: http.ServerResponse; return ProtoSSChe

static_descriptions.stats: JSON Object loaded and updated frequently, use *global.ProtoSSCheStatsFile* to set different path in application before loading index module

getModuleInstance.this: create module server instance as it is by default, initiated once by loading the module using stats configuration and prepends *global.ProtoSSCheXServerPath* to *xserverModule*
getModuleInstance.return: {serverche: ProtoSSChe, xpro: Module, xprocls: ProtoSSChe, xmodule: String}

descriptions.apps: map of id to application method

stats: {reqnum:3, xserver:true, xserverModule: "./modules/MyServer.js", cookieid: "mycookie", htport: 3000, https: true, httpsop: {keyPath, certPath, pfxPath, caPath, h2, ...anyOtherHTTPSOptionsParameter}}
